data.title: Colette Herman Service Details - NEGAUNEE, Michigan
data.meta_description: Colette R. Herman  Visitation: Tuesday, October 1, 2013 10:00 AM until 11:00 AM Koskey Funeral Home, Inc. 106 West Main Street Negaunee, MI 49866  Service: Tuesday, October 1, 2013 11:00 AM Koskey Funeral Home, Inc. 106 West Main Street Negaunee, MI 49866        Colette R. Herman  Palmer  Colette Rene Herman, 55, of Palmer, MI, died Thursday morning, September 19, 2013 in Corsicana, Texas.  Colette was born September 20, 1957 in Marquette to V. Paul and Mildred M. (DeRoche) Dobbs, graduated from Negaunee High School, Class of 1976, and was a lifelong area resident. She was employed as a cook at Little Friends Daycare several years ago, always enjoying her time spent with the kids.  In her younger years, Colette played in the Negaunee womenâ€™s pool and softball leagues, and also liked playing pinball. She enjoyed spending time at the camp on the Escanaba River, but most of all loved spending time with her friends and family, especially her grandchildren.  Surviving are her loving husband, Rick D. Herman; her father, V. Paul Dobbs; her daughter, Cheryl (Daniel Beltz) Herman of Marquette; her son, Dale (Cassie) Herman of Palmer; 2 grandchildren: Dominica and Anthony Herman; a sister, Angela Kivela of Negaunee; 2 brothers, Larry Dobbs of Negaunee Township and Joe Dobbs of Negaunee; numerous nieces, nephews and cousins. She was preceded in death by her mother on March 27, 2004.  A memorial service will be held at 11:00 am on Tuesday, Oct. 1st at the Koskey Funeral Home with Monsignor Peter Oberto officiating. The family will greet relatives and friends from 10 am until the time of services at 11 am at the funeral home on Tuesday, and also at a reception immediately following the service at the Negaunee VFW.

Order Flowers

Ordering flowers from our site ensures that your order will reach us or the family in a timely manner, and your gesture of support will remain acknowledged in the Book of Memories for future generations. We only work with local florists so we can maintain the sense of urgency and quality of your selections. We thank you for helping to support the family during their time of need, and will fondly remember your kind gesture.
